Nissan 350Z 0-60 times

Autotk.com offers accurate information on Nissan 350Z 0-60 times and quarter mile from trusted sources. You may also keep track of how 0-60 times of Nissan 350Z changed across years and check out the model’s competitors with the same acceleration performance.

Our mission is to present an easy-to-read and comprehensive information on Nissan 350Z 0-60 mph and quarter mile for the devoted geeks, as it is an essential indicator of the vehicle power.

The legendary Nissan 350Z remains a flagship among Nissan sports cars. As Jeremy Clarkson once said: "Nissan 350Z is a Japanese car with an American design from an Indian of English descent." Why did Jeremy make such a conclusion?! Simply because Ajay Panchal was one of the designers. By the way, it was designed in Nissan Design America.

A thoroughbred two-seater sports coupe is the number one on the shopping list of a person who is keen on the sporting style. The smooth shape and wide wheelbase create a pleasant first impression. Diving deeper into more detail, even the most notorious critic will admire the Nissan 350Z.

For its entire life, Nissan 350Z has only known 3,5-liter engines of VQ35 series with same engine installed at Infiniti FX. Imagine a quiet operation of the 6-cylinder V-engine. It's even nicer to put it into action. This is a lightweight engine with specifically modified intake and exhaust systems. In general, this is an excellent atmospheric engine that embodies dreams of real speed and prestigious sports car. Manufactured since 2008, the engines have a capacity of up to 313 hp. At the same time, the acceleration time declared by the manufacturer from 0 to 60 is 5.7 seconds. And the maximum speed is 250 km / h. Acceleration from zero to sixty is an important indicator of the power.

In contrast to horsepower and torque, you can not only measure it but also feel on the track. It should be noted that despite the official 0-60 times are declared to equal 5.7 seconds, car enthusiasts and testers managed to better the car's result to 5.2 seconds. Not bad, huh? It happened when driving the Nismo Coupe and the Enthusiast Coupe. Just imagine a furious start from the line, leaving all the subcompacts far behind, and not giving them the slightest chance! Suspension 350Z was developed with an eye on the best sports cars. Multi-link rear and front arrangements are completely aluminum. This made it possible to significantly reduce unsprung masses, which most positively affected the performance of the car.

Contrary to the extremals expectations, the 350 Z is equipped with active safety systems, as well as ESP. However, it was not a big issues when the vehicle was chosen for drifting in the Too Fast Too Furious: Tokyo Drift movie. As it befits a real sports car, fancy Bridgestone Potenza RE040 factory wheels wear wider 245/45 tires on the rear axle while the front wheels go with 225/45 tire size. But this car has its drawback too, which is a gearbox. Initially, they installed the 5-speed RE5R05A automatic and 6-speed FS6R31A manual. By the way, it actually sped to 5.2 seconds on the manual transmission. 

Nissan 350Z symbolizes the revival of the brand. It has an attractive appearance and an excellent motor. But does it drive like a beast? Back in 2002, 0 to 60 times around 6 seconds was the excellent result, but it is not very much impressive as of today. Therefore, nowadays this is a beautiful sports car that looks and sounds bold and catches the looks of passers-by. Nissan 350Z is the ideal car for the egoist.
